snippet: Consumer prices rose a meager 1.5 percent in December from a year earlier, making new action to boost growth increasingly likely.
abstract: China reports that inflation remains near its lowest levels in past five years; trend could give nation's central bank more room to spur economic growth and experiment with cutting benchmark interest rates and other liberal monetary policy tools.
lead_paragraph: Consumer prices rose a meager 1.5 percent in December from a year earlier, making new action to boost growth increasingly likely.

headline.main: Modest Rise in Inflation Gives China Room to Act
headline.print_headline: Modest Rise in Inflation Gives China Room to Act
